title: Configure LLVM backend to emit WebAssembly
body:
Configure the LLVM backend to target WebAssembly in addition to native code.

**Deliverables:**
- Set LLVM target triple to `wasm32-unknown-unknown` or `wasm32-wasi`
- Ensure LLVM's WebAssembly backend is available in our LLVM build (via Nix flake)
- Generate `.wasm` binary from GRIN→LLVM pipeline
- Handle Wasm-specific constraints:
  - No direct syscalls (need WASI or JS imports for IO)
  - Different memory model (linear memory)
  - No computed gotos (if used in calling convention)
- Smoke test: compile a minimal program to `.wasm`

**Design notes:**
- LLVM handles most of the Wasm complexity
- The main challenge is the runtime: our Zig runtime needs to also compile to Wasm
- WASI is the more portable option (runs in wasmtime, Node.js, browsers with polyfill)
